meanings.sent1: The success of the project was contingent on the weather cooperating.
meanings.sent2: Her happiness was contingent upon receiving good news.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring was contingent on being petted.
meanings.sent4: The plant's growth was contingent on receiving enough sunlight.
meanings.sent5: His approval was contingent on meeting all the requirements.

meanings.definition: A group of people with a common characteristic or shared interest
meanings.sent1: The book club is a contingent of avid readers.
meanings.sent2: The contingent of volunteers arrived early to help set up.
meanings.sent3: The contingent of hikers shared stories around the campfire.
meanings.sent4: The contingent of students cheered loudly at the game.
meanings.sent5: The contingent of artists showcased their work at the gallery.

meanings.definition: A group of soldiers or police officers
meanings.sent1: The military contingent marched in perfect formation.
meanings.sent2: The police contingent arrived at the scene to control the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The contingent of soldiers trained rigorously for the mission.
meanings.sent4: The contingent of officers patrolled the neighborhood to ensure safety.
meanings.sent5: The contingent of troops stood ready for deployment.

meanings.definition: A future event or circumstance that is possible but cannot be predicted with certainty
meanings.sent1: The contingency of rain forced them to move the party indoors.
meanings.sent2: They had a contingency plan in case the main speaker couldn't make it.
meanings.sent3: The contingency of a power outage led them to buy extra candles.
meanings.sent4: Having a contingency for emergencies is always a good idea.
meanings.sent5: The contingency of a delayed flight made them arrive at the airport early.
